image.altText: A teenage boy in formal wear standing in an event hall with white chairs and cake

props.synopsis: The brother of 17-year-old boy Mehdi Habibi, who went missing in waters off Victor Harbor, has detailed the moments before the teenager fell from rocks during a family gathering at the popular tourist spot.

title.children: Missing teen's anguished family say he was posing for photo when he was swept off rocks

image.altText: Dubbo Courthouse

props.synopsis: Gino Margiotta will remain behind bars for sexually assaulting a woman while travelling 13 years ago, an incident she says broke her "heart and trust".

title.children: South Australian man jailed for historical sexual assault in NSW

image.altText: Zak Butters looks at the ball

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide skipper Connor Rozee says his vice-captain Zak Butters, who is suffering an eye infection, will be fine to play in the qualifying final.

title.children: Port dismiss mounting injury concerns ahead of qualifying final

image.altText: Skyscapers make up a very business end of town skyline

props.synopsis: As Australian mortgage holders wait for relief, the Reserve Bank of New Zealand cuts rates and green shoots emerge in the housing market.

title.children: In NZ, interest rates have finally been cut. Now, the housing market is responding

image.altText: Electronic gaming machines at a gambling venue

props.synopsis: Australians lead the world when it comes to gambling. But the only area of gaming and gambling where we appear to be lacking is in the area of legislation and oversight.

title.children: Why Australia is addicted to gambling

image.altText: Mike Burgess wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: Head of ASIO Mike Burgess says his comments on the vetting process for people fleeing Gaza were misrepresented in the political storm over the issue of visas being offered to people trying to leave the war zone.

title.children: 'People have chosen to distort what I said': ASIO boss Mike Burgess on Gaza visas

image.altText: A man and woman stand next to each other in a country town.

props.synopsis: Stuart Harris was one of the first people on the scene of his 17-year-old daughter's fatal car crash. Advocates say it's all too common in regional areas.

title.children: Family members serve as first responders to rural road crashes amid calls for more support

image.altText: A child being held by a female doctor

props.synopsis: Despite being just a 90-minute flight from Darwin, nurse Joy Booth says the health service in Timor-Leste is 'light years away from what is provided in Australia'. But that doesn't stop her and other volunteers from providing life-changing surgeries for babies and young children.

title.children: Adelaide nurse shares joys and challenges of operating in Timor-Leste

props.synopsis: As technology continues to evolve, tracking skills are not being called on as often for police investigations. But there are hopes the unique skill can be preserved. WARNING: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander readers are advised that this story includes the name and images of Indigenous people who have died.

title.children: An abducted girl was found by an acclaimed tracker. There's fears that skill set could be lost

image.altText: A young man in a tropical shirt with

props.synopsis: Six months after he was kidnapped into Gaza with a grisly injury, 23-year-old Hersh Goldberg-Polin stunned everyone by appearing alive in a hostage video. His sudden death at the weekend has galvanised a nation.

title.children: After surviving the unthinkable, Hersh died in a Gaza tunnel. Here's why many Israelis blame Netanyahu

image.altText: A QFES logo on a truck.

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation has heard from more than a dozen people about allegations of a "macho hero" culture in Queensland's fire service.

title.children: 'Attractive' female firefighting recruits subjected to 'bell ringing' at Brisbane training academy

image.altText: Geo blowing vape towards the camera

props.synopsis: A survey of more than 5,000 year 7 and 8 students across three states found teenagers who vape were more likely to have poor mental health.

title.children: Geo says vaping gives him a rush, but he believes there's a link between it and his mental health

image.altText: Tanya Plibersek staring at an out of focus Anthony Albanese.

props.synopsis: The federal government has signalled it is willing to make its proposed environmental protection agency more business-friendly, in a major concession designed to win Coalition support that environment groups have branded a "betrayal."

title.children: PM offers to water down planned environmental watchdog to secure Coalition support

image.altText: The shadow of a young woman can be seen in front of the triple j sign

props.synopsis: Forced marriage is the most common form of human trafficking in Australia. We speak to a victim-survivor about how she escaped.

title.children: Aisha was engaged by the time she was 13. Within three years she'd taken her parents to court to escape a forced marriage

image.altText: Rising river levels has floods an historic property

props.synopsis: Tasmanians are hoping for a reprieve from days of wind and heavy rain, as the state takes stock of the widespread damage. Follow live

title.children: Wild weather eases for Tasmania after flooded rivers peaks

props.synopsis: We all know the pain of a blaring alarm clock after a late night, but sleep deprivation does more than just bring our mood down. This is what happens when you consistently short change yourself of a good night's rest.

title.children: Not getting enough sleep? This is what’s happening to your body and brain

image.altText: A woman sitting at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Nine years after Japanese journalist Shiori Ito was allegedly raped by a powerful man, she has produced a documentary, Black Box Diaries, chronicling her road to justice.

title.children: How Japan changed after journalist Shiori Ito opened the 'black box' of sexual violence

image.altText: an aerial view of a lithium ore crushing facility

props.synopsis: Slowing EV sales and a flood of new supply have seen the price of lithium fall off a cliff, but Australian miners are confident in a lithium-fuelled future.

title.children: These two Australian miners have been riding the lithium rollercoaster — one is hopping off while the other doubles down

props.synopsis: Residents say they're in fear of youth crime in Melbourne's outer south-east, but lawyers and advocates worry the solutions may make it worse.

title.children: 'Fear' over youth crime but warnings against 'reckless' solutions

image.altText: Australia's relay team celebrates Paralympic gold medal

props.synopsis: Just three years after being in a coma, Alexa Leary has starred in the mixed 4x100m medley relay to help Australian win the gold medal. Follow the action in our live blog.

title.children: 'She never ceases to amaze': Alexa Leary leads stunning comeback to help Australia claim mixed relay gold

image.altText: A woman wearing a blue jacket and black top walks down a street

props.synopsis: Senator Linda Reynolds did not always believe Brittany Higgins had been raped and even attempted to "smear" her former staffer to cast doubt on her credibility, a court has been told.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann buying Brittany Higgins a coffee was used as an attempt to besmirch her, defamation trial told

image.altText: An outstretched hand close-up with a gold nugget in the open palm.

props.synopsis: An earth-shaking experiment links the same principles found in your barbecue lighter to the creation of gold nuggets.

title.children: Gold nuggets are often found in quartz — scientists think they now know why

image.altText: A teenage girl wearing glasses in a classroom.

props.synopsis: Two systems, one huge problem. Tasmanian children are being failed by a dual purpose education system that seems to suit no-one.

title.children: Just over half of this state's kids finish Year 12. An economist says the system is failing them

image.altText: People help an injured man walk in the middle of rubble

props.synopsis: Kyiv officials report a series of explosions as Moscow launches a strike against the Ukrainian capital, sending residents fleeing into bomb shelters.

title.children: Russia launches barrage of drones, cruise and ballistic missiles at Kyiv

image.altText: Dreamworld logo sign at entrance to the theme park on Queensland's Gold Coast.

props.synopsis: An experienced animal handler has been hospitalised with serious lacerations and puncture wounds to her arm and shoulder.

title.children: Woman hospitalised after being bitten by tiger at Dreamworld

image.altText: A bare-chested man sitting in a chair, leaning abck with his eyes closed.

props.synopsis: Heatwaves loom as a growing threat to humanity in a warming climate. This summer alone, in the northern hemisphere, thousands have died during extreme heat events. It's driving researchers to find out more about the point when heat turns deadly.

title.children: In a groundbreaking experiment, humans were exposed to a deadly combination of heat and humidity. Here's how long they lasted

image.altText: two bodies on a tiled floor covered with Palestinian flags, surrounded by mourners.

props.synopsis: The daily reality in the West Bank is that settlers or soldiers are able to threaten or kill unarmed Palestinians knowing that as long as they say they felt threatened they will face no real accountability.

title.children: Israel's conduct in the West Bank has worried even some in Israel

image.altText: For sale sign outside an apartment building along a street in Brisbane on October 31, 2018.

props.synopsis: Australian house prices have continued to rise, but the real estate market is showing signs of slowing, according to new data.

title.children: What August's house price data tells us about where values are headed

image.altText: Jim Chalmers wears a navy suit, looking solemnly off camera.

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers has blamed successive interest rate rises for "smashing the economy", as the government braces for more weak economic figures due this week.

title.children: Expecting bad economic news, Chalmers blames interest rate rises for 'smashing' economy

image.altText: A man in flannel puts his arm around a woman in a puffer jacket in a backyard. They look dejected

props.synopsis: Predatory lowball cash settlements from insurance companies to victims of flood damage are a serious issue, with the peak body for financial counsellors revealing underquoting is rife.

title.children: The Haimeses had 'gold insurance cover' but when their house flooded, they nearly fell victim to a common trap

image.altText: Protesters march on a street holding a banner that reads "Fascism is not an opinion, it's a crime" in German.

props.synopsis: An election in the little-known German state of Thuringia has been thrust into the global spotlight after seeing a far-right nationalist party win for the first time since World War Two.

title.children: A far-right party has won a state election in Germany for the first time since Nazi rule. Here's what it means

image.altText: A man in glasses, China's ambassador to the Pacific nations Qian Bo, wearing a blue shirt.

props.synopsis: The Pacific's top regional body has denied it has buckled to Chinese pressure by deleting a line about Taiwan in a communique issued by leaders late last week, suggesting instead that an administrative error is to blame instead.

title.children: Pacific officials say error to blame for 'deeply unfortunate' Taiwan reference that angered China

image.altText: Alexei Popyrin looks to one side

props.synopsis: Alexei Popryin will be left to rue his missed opportunities after falling to American number 20 seed Frances Tiafoe in four sets at the US Open.

title.children: Alexei Popyrin rues second set 'choke' as US Open journey ends at hands of Frances Tiafoe

image.altText: Military Rd site aerial view

props.synopsis: A vacant copper smelter site at Port Kembla is up for sale but the operator says at least 300 homes nearby still have heavy metal contamination.

title.children: Decades of pollution leave legacy of contamination in beachside suburb
